newsitem.title: INDIA: India's Gujarat Gas up 10.0 pct at BSE.
newsitem.headline: India's Gujarat Gas up 10.0 pct at BSE.

text.p: Shares of Indian natural gas distributor Gujarat Gas Company Ltd rose 13.0 rupees, or nearly 10 percent, to 144.0 rupees at the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) on Friday after another firm said it was planning to sell its stake in Gujarat Gas, dealers said.

An Arvind Mafatlal group (AMG) official told Reuters on Thursday it was planning to sell its 35 percent holding in Gujarat Gas to "leading national and international firms." A final decision is expected shortly, he said.
Market talk that Enron Oil & Gas Company of the U.S. would pick up the AMG stake helped create buying interest, dealers said.
Enron was one of the firms the AMG group was talking to, the company official said, but denied a newspaper report which suggested the deal had been clinched.
